ratings.comment: Staley's a little dry when he's in lecture mode, but he's really nice and sweet and funny otherwise. There's a good deal of reading but I thought they were really interesting.  I was able to ace the papers just by drawing on the readings, so I wouldn't say taking notes during lecture is strictly necessary. Just sit back and listen.

Lectures are hard to take notes on. Most of reading is dull. 3 essays (1200 words) with tough prompts that require you to cite a lot of course material for a good grade. TONS of reading. I was disappointed with this course and the professor's style of teaching. Hope for good TA. Mostly boring.
Tough class but good teacher.

There is a lot of reading (1500 plus pages) but you'll learn a lot. Richard is very sharp and will give you a good grade if you try hard. Take this class if your purpose of attending college is to learn something and not just get easy "A's"

If you are taking this course just because you hate labs and want an "easy" science class, don't take it. However,in my experience with Professor Staley, he was easily one of the friendliest, most brilliant professors on campus and his class was extremely eye opening.  Didn't realize until recently how much I still apply knowledge from this class
Great Prof., always nice and ready to help.His class might be though for the amount of reading but it's totally wort it

AVOID THIS CLASS AT ALL COSTS. It's so hard! Literally impossible to get a good grade on the take home exams in case by some chance you share the same opinion on the topic as your TA. The lectures are so boring, and it's hard to see the main points. Terrible class, worst grade of the semester. And I'm pre-pharm.

Difficult course, regardless of what others say. I've been writing history essays since my freshman year, and the HoS TAs can be SO TOUGH on grading. The lectures are totally useless and while discussion was the most useful part, the three papers were absolutely the pickiest ones I've ever had to write. I hear the ILS portion is much better.

Difficult to take notes on lectures: 1. Paints a picture of all the details on a topic, then finishes with the main point..leaving notes disorganized 2. Speaks in an extended manner..must keep focused. Readings: 800pages+5novels. A few great reads. 3 essay exams. Key: apply his types of historical analyses on essay topic and youll do fine.

This class is very dull. Do not take if you don't have to. NO tests, only papers. Discussion is required. The class has a boat load of readings and worksheets each week. The readings are not interesting at all. However, it is not hard to get a good grade on the papers if you attend lecture and complete the readings.

Class was not as interesting as I thought it was going to be. There is a lot of reading and worksheets to fill out with it.  Most of the reading is not that interesting and the lectures are boring too.  There are no tests just papers. discussions are required. Not that hard to get good grades on the papers but you have to do a lot of homework.

I've been sitting in class now for about 15 minutes and I don't have a clue what he's talking about. This is not unusual. He is as boring as this class is useless. Great for a science credit, and also great for nap time. NEVER take this class if you can avoid it; it's voluntary torture.

He's a great man--kind, friendly, smart. Could improve as a lecturer. Lectures dull, discussions not helpful. Readings even less so. Basically, either do the readings or go to lecture. Discussion is what you make of it, but it's more helpful just to talk to your TA if you want to do well in the class.

This is my favorite professor! The material was well organized and he made connections among the topics we covered. His lectures are intriguing, and you get a chance to read lots of primary documents. He is very approachable and interesting. I will definitely be taking another class with Professor Staley and very highly recommend him.

Avoid this guy, his lectures are very poorly organized and he jumps around so much that he is incomprehensible most of the time. Do not take this class, it's terrible, go with Schatzberg he is a lot better. Avoid Bridget Collins she is the most subjective TA I have ever had... RUN!

Although extremely boring, Staley's delightfully unexpected pronunciations of words like "nomenclature" and "eugenics" keep you awake...sort of. If you're looking for an easy A, but not necessarily intellectual stimulation, this is your class. Take it with Kellen Backer as your TA if at all possible.

I don't know who to blame more, Staley or my TA - but this class absolutely sucks.  Both lectures and discussions have absolutely no flow,grading, which is curved at a BC, is blatantly subjective and to add fuel to the fire, the class is by far the most uninteresting class I have taken in my 3.5 years of college... DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
rarely went to class...staley is a nice guy but lectures are basically tranquilizer darts. take home essays are EASY and don't require lecture knowledge-just the readings will do.

He's a nice guy, and seems interested in what he's talking about. I have no interest in the history of science, and his lectures didn't spark my interest any further. He makes only a weak attempt at an outline, and I always felt as though his lectures were disorganized.
Interesting professor. Knows his stuff well. Extremely approachable and friendly. It's a joy going for his lectures. Recommended if you're interested in history or the origins of science.

Intelligent man, but material is boring unless you enjoy learning about the many tedious men behind the 'history of science'. Lectures can be skipped once in a while, though notes are helpful as midterms/final are take-home essays. Australian accent is a plus!
most dull and uninteresting professor i have ever had...really weird hair too...absolutely dreaded going to the class every time i had it..if i even went
BORING and USELESS.

Good guy, knows what he's talking about and is [assionate about it.  But quizzes every other week on boring readings suck, and the class content in general is boring.  Wouldn't recommend the class unless you love history.

An overall good professer, you can tell he is interested in what he is talking about.  Testing is  in essay form, they are kind of difficult, but if you take good notes in lecture and keep up with readings you will be ok :)
